intro: Pseudognaphalium obtusifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. Its leaves are typically broad and slightly rounded, with a soft, fuzzy texture. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
